name: MOOGme
tagline: A python interface around MOOG, the stellar spectra code
body:
### Welcome to MOOGme
MOOGme is a python package to make a simple interface around LTE software [MOOG](http://www.as.utexas.edu/~chris/moog.html). The acronym stands for `MOOG made easy`.


### Features
With this software, stellar atmospheric parameters can be derived based on the EW method.


### Planned features
We plan to add features in the future. This include:

   - A GUI to control the process
   - Multiple atmospheric models (currently only 1 grid is supported)
   - Package like a real python package (pypi)
   - Synthesis of spectral regions (not decided yet)
   - Implementing [ARES](http://www.astro.up.pt/~sousasag/ares/)


### Authors and Contributors
The authors of this package are @MariaTsantaki, @gdcteixeira, and @DanielAndreasen.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with the package? Feel free to report a bug/issue at the [issue pages](https://github.com/DanielAndreasen/MOOGme/issues) or create a [pull request](https://github.com/DanielAndreasen/MOOGme/pulls) and weâ€™ll try our best to help you.
